data.title: Carry On Last of the Summer Wine
data.meta_description:
Just for fun, how many Carry On actors and actresses can be find that have appeared in Last of the Summer Wine?

This includes all the bit players and less...
data.text:
Just for fun, how many Carry On actors and actresses can be find that have appeared in Last of the Summer Wine?

This includes all the bit players and less known people.

Here's two to start the ball rolling:

Frank Thornton (Truly and Carry On Screaming)

John Bluthal (Brushes at Dawn and Carry On Follow That Camel)

Liz Fraser been in several Carry On's Regardless , Cruising etc and was of course was Reggie Unsworth Compo's Thursday lady . Norman Rossington was in Carry on Nurse, Regardless and of course was Mr Microwave in Beware the Elbow .I mentioned John Jardine who was a guard Carry on Spying and was Billy Pilsworth in the Afterthoughts of a Coop Manager amongst other appearances in LOTSW

Brian Rawlinson was the traffic warden in 3 episodes from the 1990s (a semi regular who was possibly planned for more appearances) and was in Carry On Cruising, Carry On Cleo and Carry On Cowboy.

Margaret Nolan, Connie in LOTSW episode Pate and Chips, was also in Carry On Dick, Carry On Girls, Carry On Matron, Carry On At Your Convenience, Carry On Henry and Carry On Cowboy.

Burt Kwouk was of course Entwistle in LOTSW and sadly for such a great actor , he was in the wonderful Pink Panther films for god sake, he was in the atrocious Carry on Columbus

Lynda Baron (Getting Sam Home) was also in Carry On Columbus.

Norman Mitchell from Beware of the Oglethorpe played a drunk in Carry On Emmannuelle.

Very good question to pose wstol!

Kenneth Cole was in The Love Mobile & All That Glitters is not Elvis, he appeared in numerous Carry On Films including, Carry On Jack, Nurse & At your Convenience and probably more.....

On the subject of the Carry On's I'm reading the Kenneth Williams official biography, I think he would've been a wonderful in a role in LOTSW! Interestingly he also acted with Peter Sallis in an Orson Wells play.
